reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Setting up of clubs in targeted community secondary schools in the Niger Delta

description.narrative: A significant number of youths across targeted schools in the Niger Delta are beginning to campaign against environmental pollution including those triggered by third party interference which is causing much of oil spills and other environmental issues in the region. At the level where this campaign by youths. leads to significant reduction in oil spills triggered by third party, this activity would have achieved mid level outcome and on its way to achieving upper level outcome which is a clean and safe Niger Delta with flourishing livelihoods

participating-org.narrative: Centre for Environment Human Rights and Development (CEHRD)
Foundation for Environmental Right and Advocacy (FENRAND)
Foundation for the Conservatio of the Earth- FOCONE

activity-date.narrative: School clubs were established and given adequate environmental education which is expected to form their minds for better management of the environment as they grow into adulthood.

organisation.narrative: All project inquiries are directed to the National Coordinator of NACGOND

recipient-country.narrative: This activity was implemented in some parts of the Niger Delta particularly Akwa Ibom, Cross River and Rivers State.

sector.narrative: Activity was aimed at forming the minds of youths in secondary schools so that, their environmental consciousness will be stimulated as they grow into adulthood.
